segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and no one is stopping it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on that plate, it’s almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really stretching to get those cookies, and the stool is wobbling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if he’s going to make it or if he’ll fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting so patiently.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so mad when she finally notices everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting more and more slippery, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside is pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman looks while everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just so strange and unsettling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone is going to do anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR
